question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
What is the greatest common divisor of $7979$ and $3713$?
inference:
**Solution:**
$$7979 = 17 \cdot 469$$
$$3713 = 17 \cdot 218$$
$$\newline$$
So, the greatest common divisor of $7979$ and $3713$ is $17$.
$$\newline$$
**Final Answer: $\boxed{17}$. I hope it is correct.**
ground_truth:
We can use the Euclidean Algorithm to find the greatest common divisor of these two integers. \begin{align*}
\gcd(7979, 3713) &= \gcd(3713, 7979 - 2\cdot 3713) \\
&= \gcd(3713, 553) \\
&= \gcd(553, 3713 - 6\cdot 553) \\
&= \gcd(553, 395) \\
&= \gcd(395, 553 - 395) \\
&= \gcd(395, 158) \\
&= \gcd(158, 395- 2\cdot 158) \\
&= \gcd(158, 79) \\
&= \boxed{79}.
\end{align*}
